education.title: Information Technology Degree
education.description: Currently on my first semester where I will soon be tackling different projects.
mainTech: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology

icons.title: Japanese Language
icons.description: I studied Japanese at the Polaris Learning and Assessment Center, Inc. Japanese is so intriguing to me that I started studying it, especially now that I'm getting hooked on anime. It would really help me understand the anime without subtitles, but it would also create an opportunity for me to possibly work in Japan.

icons.title: Watching Cybersecurity Related Videos
icons.description: I am currently getting into cybersecurity in my free time, and it has been very hard, although enjoyable. Learning Linux and other things that are needed to follow the videos that I'm watching is not an easy task, but I think of it as a challenge because this is one of my career choices.

icons.title: Manga
icons.description: I've fallen profoundly in love with Japanese manga lately. I've finished reading Berserk and Vinland Saga, and I recently started reading The Art of Vagabond by Takehiko Inoue. Highly recommended!

icons.title: Video Games
icons.description: I also love playing video games, especially the FPS types. I really liked indie games like Stardew Valley because they helped me relieve stress in my life. Although these days I hardly play because of the heavy workload.

icons.title: Gym
icons.description: Going to the gym is like going to therapy for me. It helps me alleviate my mood and keep my focus on important things. It also gives me the strength to be confident in myself and to continue improving every day, even if it's just 1%.

icons.title: Reading Books
icons.description: I rarely read books, but currently I am making it a habit. Self-improvement books such as Atomic Habits and The Art of Not Giving a Fuck are some of my favorites. One of the struggles I've been facing to make it a habit is money. Books are expensive, and I don't want those free e-books online because I also want to reduce my screen time, so yeah.

experience.title: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (BSIT)

experience.title: Cybersecurity
experience.description: I like to study cybersecurity in my free time, and it really interests me, and it literally becomes one of the aspirations that I have for my career path choice. Currently, I watch video tutorials and lessons about network security engineering. In the near future, I would also apply for workshops to further enhance my knowledge in this field.
